title: Men’s lycra pioneer Rapha faces an uphill pedal to combat biking downturn
text:
Bentonville in the north-east tip of Arkansas is not only home to Walmart headquarters, it’s fast becoming a hub for cyclists too.

The Ozark mountains that wrap around the city host a network of 400 miles of mountain bike trails. Bentonville’s 50,000 inhabitants are treated to more than 30 cycling events each year.

The billionaire Walmart dynasty are the driving force behind this passion for pedalling, funding trail building and many of the competitions.

Third generation grocers Steuart and Tom Walton, heirs to a $159bn (£124bn) fortune, are bike mad.

Eyebrows were raised when the brothers bought upmarket British cycling apparel brand Rapha in 2017. The £200m price tag seemed punchy for a trophy...
